website_summaries.verdict: A great shooting recoil pad that comes in several sizes for a better fit on various gun types.
pros: Semi-hard and rigid noise and vibration dampening material is comfortable on the shoulder and dampens vibrations from shooting
Different sizes fit most types of rifles better than universal sizes
cons: Recoil pad has a tendency to slip around, possibly off, when shooting over a period of time

customer_reviews.title: A must have for a Mosin Nagant.
customer_reviews.text: The Mosin Nagant rifle is notorious for its heavy recoil, which isn't mitigated at all by the metal butt pad. The Limbsaver Airtech Small Slip-On fits perfectly on Mosin Nagant 91/30. The result is tremendous. Felt recoil becomes easily manageable. After installation I put over 100 rounds through the rifle without any shoulder pain, bruising, or soreness. It made the rifle an absolute pleasure to shoot. The only minor drawback is that it slips around a little, which can be corrected very quickly. For the Mosin Nagant, I highly recommend the small size with a 1" LOP over the small/medium with the .5" LOP.
customer_reviews.author: GlibRemark

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Mossberg 500 and Dickinson Hunter Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Got the Small 1" version for my Mossberg 500 and my Dickinson Hunter 12 gauge O/U. Fits both guns perfectly. The Mossberg has a little more kick than the dickinson, but this pad makes shooting birdshot feel like nothing. Slugs and heavy buckshot get painful after a while. The Dickinson has a lot less recoil naturally by itself, and this pad makes it feel like nothing as well. I'm just using that gun for shooting clays, so I can't comment on how it feels with buck or slugs. Great value for the price, and I will definitely get more when I get any more shotguns.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Remington 870 Express: Get the small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a medium and its TOO BIG. I ended up reading dozens of reviews on size and want to lay the issue to rest: Get the small size if you have a Remington 870 Express. Medium is loose around the sides and is not a snug fit. I ended up getting the Pachmayr stock pad (small as well) instead because time of this writing, its half the price and amazon is out of stock on the smalls.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Turned a pain into a pleasure!
customer_reviews.text: Recently got my daughter a rossi matched pair with a .22lr and a .410. While the .22 presented no issue, due to the lightness of the rifle and how narrow the stock was, the .410 packed a solid kick for me, and knocked her 7 year old self around fairly badly, which discouraged her from using the weapon. This recoil pad helped account for that light and narrow stock, and made it so she hardly noticed firing 3" shells. I got her some 2 1/2 inch shells with #6 shot and she had no issue! Begs to shoot the 2 1/2 shells all the time!
customer_reviews.author: JvC

customer_reviews.title: It just works, no need to second guess it
customer_reviews.text: Great pad works as advertised, made my Keltec KSG much more manageable, even on my brothers 12 gauge Mossberg it reduced felt recoil by a ton enough for him to order one the next day after trying mine, don't get me wrong if you're shooting 3 inch 1 1/4 oz slugs you're still going to feel it, granted a heck of a lot less than you would if you didn't have this product. Couldn’t be happier, best $20 I've ever spent on a gun accessory hands down. Don't overthink this one, it's a solid buy and you won't run the risk of getting a dud, they're all made from the same molds so you should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with these
customer_reviews.text: I have Limbsaver Airtech slip-ons on all my shotguns but, because it would fit, this is the first time I bought this size...with the 1/2" cushion. It turns out I prefer it over the 1" models/sizes. I like all of them, and I rated them 5-stars too, but I prefer this one. On a related note, I cover my stocks with a neoprene sleeve in order to alleviate the sticky surface of the Airtech from grabbing/catching on my sleeves. It's an easy fix, and the one I use/recommend (B***tooth) is on Amazon too. No, I have no affiliation with either product.
customer_reviews.author: K & G

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases in regards to improving my shooting experience.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my SKB O/U shotgun. This limbsaver fits perfect and does not slip or move on my shotgun. I have used it in the cold winter in Iowa and in the warm temps in southern New Mexico. It significantly reduces the recoil to my old shoulder and the added 1/2” to my LOP makes a better fit when shouldering my gun which has improved my shooting. I purchased a second one for my Stoeger Condor with the same results.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Lots of sizes allow close tolerance fit.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for the added length of pull on my shotgun. Slipped right on with no issues. Variety of sizes available helped me zero in on the exact size needed. Note: Measure the width and height of your butt stock. Then scroll horizontally through the recoil pad sizes listed for a size that your measurements fit into. I had a Winchester model 1400 and the measurements indicated that a small/ medium should fit. It is not a super tight fit but works in the field. No slipping on the gun and added the length I needed.
customer_reviews.author: J M

customer_reviews.title: Make's a world of different, I wish I bought it earlier!
customer_reviews.text: Hesitated to buy this initially because there are cheaper options, but I'm so glad I didn't cheap out, because this thing really is worth it! Used it for a 12 Gauge. Before I had this, a day at the range shooting 80 rounds would leave me with a sore and bruised shoulder. Just took it out for a long range day, over 200 rounds (Slugs, Buckshot, & Birdshot), and no bruising, no pain. I'm very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Tames my Harrington & Richardson Pardner Pump. That's a 12 guage, short barreled, Remington clone with a plastic stock. Nasty recoil in it's native state, but the limb saver really tones it down to almost fun.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Keillor

customer_reviews.title: This has REALLY helped with the recoil on my Winchester 30-06
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble getting the exact fit using the custom products that Limb Saver offers. I finally had to get the slip on pad, and boy has it ever made a difference. I no longer anticipate the recoil on the rifle, which has transformed my accuracy. I highly recommend this product, and the customer support is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Teknurd

customer_reviews.title: Size S/M fits Marlin 1895
customer_reviews.text: The Small/Medium size recoil pad fits the Marlin 1895 perfectly. Mine is in 45-70 govt. but I do not think stock dimensions differ from caliber to caliber. I first ordered the medium and it was far too loose on the stock, but the S/M is just right and half the price as the Medium. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: beau sandland

customer_reviews.title: surprised me
customer_reviews.text: I had low expectations. Normally I go and shoot my Ruger M77MII in 30-06 just enough to confirm the scope is still sighted in, any more that a few shots and my shoulder hurts from the recoil of the light gun combined with the fast .30 cal loads I run. With the limbsaver I didn't have any discomfort and I was able to spent some additional time exercising my gun and my 2a rights. Thanks Limbsaver.
customer_reviews.author: Brik

customer_reviews.title: Done in less than 20 min and now I have a great fitting shotgun
customer_reviews.text: Have a Franchi Afffinity and the LOP was just too long. It has a curved end on the factory recoil pad, but I am not afraid of cutting down a synthetic stock. I took off the factory pad, made my cut to fit my LOP, squared it up, rounded the edges and then added the AirTech Slip on. So much easier than trying to scribe a line to follow the factory buttplate/pad. Done in less than 20 min and now I have a great fitting shotgun. Cheap and easy and made the gun fit me perfect (after cutting it down). I took measurements and ordered a small based on where my cuts were going to be.
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Fits good on my Mossberg 835 Ulti-Mag. Just had to remove the original factory recoil pad, which had hardened-up over the years so it had become extremely unpleasant to shoot 3-1/2" loads. Now it's back to being just moderately unpleasant, which is how it has always been. Couldn't find a custom-fit model to that matched, but for a slip-on this one is worth the money for sure. It was either that or sell the beast, because there was an ER visit looming if I kept shooting it without it!
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing reduction in perceived recoil
customer_reviews.text: Small size fits perfectly on a Stoeger M3000. Amazing reduction in perceived recoil. However, you MUST remove the stock recoil pad before putting on the LimbSaver, otherwise the LimbSaver will slip after just a few shots (despite fitting very tight). Without the stock pad, the LimbSaver stays in place perfectly and works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Russian

customer_reviews.title: Use medium to slip over 870 woodstock while keeping existing buttstock pad
customer_reviews.text: The medium fits over existing buttstock pad on the Remington 870 woodstock. I kept the original buttstock pad on and slipped this over to add 1” LOP and it works great. The longer LOP gives me a perfect cheek weld and it has improved my aim. It absorbs shock well although I have not tried it for any length of time. I was still sore for shooting earlier in the week and I put another 50 rounds using the new Limbsaver pad and did not aggravate the previous bruise. I would definitely recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: James D.

customer_reviews.title: Mossberg 500 synthetic stock.
customer_reviews.text: There was definite improvement in recoil, but during use, mine slipped as well. Caused a lag in acquiring made it a no go for me. Mossberg 500, synthetic stock.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Maybe my expectations was too high.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using a small/medium on my Mossberg 500 All Purpose Field with a wood stock. It does take some recoil out of 12 gauge slugs, but it still hurts pretty bad that I get a bit hesitant to shoot again after 2-3 shots. Like I said, maybe I had too high of expectations for this. It is nicer than not having it, but not by much.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Great results
customer_reviews.text: I rarely give 5 stars, but this recoil pad is awesome. I recently decided to move up to a larger caliber rifle (30-06). Took it to the range to sight the scope, and learned what recoil really is! I purchased the AirTech slip-on with hopes of bringing the pounding to a less bruising level. This pad exceeded my hopes and really put the fun factor into shooting this gun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it was made exactly for my Mossberg Patriot .308 .
customer_reviews.text: Second Limbsaver I purchased. First one was for a 12 gauge shotgun and it definite helped with reducing the pain of recoil. When looking for an addition for my .308 rifle, first area I checked was for one to install on the butt of my stock for my Mossberg Patriot rifle. I have not tried it out yet for this rifle since I just received it today but I have no doubt that it will work just fine and reduce the kick from firing off a .308. Installed within seconds and looks like it was made exactly for my rifle.
customer_reviews.author: ojustme

customer_reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL!!!
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a Remington Model 700. Had to remove the original pad (which is hard as a rock) due to being too far back from scope when gun is shouldered. Install was easy and after taking a few shots I could only think one thing...why did I wait so long to do this. The kick from the .270 was darn near non existent. I couldn't believe the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Brush WolfTop Contributor: Snowboarding

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, but too big.
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping and easy to install. However, comma, it is too big for my shotgun. If I takeoff my factory installed shoulder pad and install this one, it is a tad bit loose. If I reinstall my factory installed shoulder pad, then I have to readjust my grip for the extra inch that this pad adds. I don’t see a smaller pad available. If there is one, please let me know and I will send this one back and get the smaller one. Thanks for making this, I hope I get to use it properly one day.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Frasier

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for M1 Garand
customer_reviews.text: This is the one to buy. Stop looking because you just found the best one. I bought 3 types and the other two are going back. This pad is better than I expected. I even shot rifle in my undershirt only and it's fantastic. Plus it looks really good. This is very important. It goes on in a breeze and comes off just as easily but stays in place when shooting. I did your research for you. Buy the 'LARGE'. I am very pleased indeed. Just get it.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Shoulder saver
customer_reviews.text: My 10+ year one of these started to tear on the top where it rubs my arm pit when raising the gun up. So happy with that one bought another. Actually already had these on all my guns that kick. Takes what would be like being poked with one finger on your shoulder to a push with a fist Much better! I do put a bead of silicone under these between the stock and it to make sure it stays put. Very much recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slipon Pad works, Fitted Pad is Wrong Size
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd time I've tried to buy a fitted pad for a rifle and it is not the right size or measurements. At this point, I honestly couldn't recommend buying a fitted pad. If you're after that finished pad look on a rifle, I'd say get a larger pad that a gunsmith can sand down to the correct size to get the factory look in a pad. If you don't mind the looks (or it's right before deer season, etc.), the slip-on pad works great and won't scratch up your stock surface or put any unnecessary holes in it.
customer_reviews.author: CalHunter

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for my Ruger 10/22 takedown
customer_reviews.text: No, I didn't buy this to reduce recoil on a .22 caliber, I bought it to extend the length of the stock. I added the stock spacers provided with the rifle, but I am 6'3" and wanted to lengthen the stock for more comfort and eye relief with a scope. This LimbSaver fits perfectly and was easy to install. Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for high-power rifles.
customer_reviews.text: Add this and a suppressor to a .30-06, and even a teenager can handle it as if it were a .22-250. Very impressive. I've never been able to keep my eye on a target with my .30-06 until I added this and a suppressor. Only drawback is that it's one-size-fits-all, so even though the size is about right, the angle isn't perfect, and it's a little sloppy on my stock (Tikka T3 lite factory stock).
customer_reviews.author: KesseJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Medium size fit perfectly on my 12 ga. Over and under. Kick drastically reduced. After a full day of shooting, my shoulder felt the same as when I first showed up.
customer_reviews.author: Colt

customer_reviews.title: nice but too big for my  Marlin 45-70 1895GBL
customer_reviews.text: nice - but too big for my Marlin 45-70 1895GBL.
customer_reviews.author: Russell R. Herman

customer_reviews.title: No more beat up shoulder.
customer_reviews.text: Felt recoil on my Marlin lever action in 45/70 is now mild enough to shoot more then 5-10 rounds. Now I can shoot comfortably threw 50 rounds. I'm very glad I spent the money and picked this pad up. It's worth the money spent. Now I can use my right arm after shooting the 45/70 cartridge with a 405 gr lead bullet . This is great for me!!!.
customer_reviews.author: Crossdrawjohn

customer_reviews.title: Had to buy another one for myself.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for a high standard shotgun that my kids mom uses. I liked it so much that I bought a second pad for my mossberg 590 with magpul SGA stock, fit nice and snug. Wrapped it with foam tape to keep it from grabbing my shirt. I have the medium/small. Absolutely love it! Now I can shoot a box of shells at the range without the sore shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: J. Grajeda

customer_reviews.title: Extends Lenth of Pull and How Long You Can Shoot
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these now on multiple rifles. I originally bought these as a cheap way to extend the length of pull (stock length), but they do make a huge difference in reducing recoil. I can shoot older .30 caliber rifles like my M1903, M1917, Mausers, and Mosins much longer without destroying my shoulder. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: The_Cooler

customer_reviews.title: Genuinely Incredible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my M1 Garand. The 30-06 is known to be quite a stout cartridge, and my Garand definitely showed that. It was hard to enjoy the gun because of it, and I really wanted to be able to shoot it and have fun with it. I ordered this after my first outing, and it has made an unbelievable difference. My gun went from painful to pleasant, it was unbelievable. Now I can shoot it all day without even feeling it. If you’re even considering getting a recoil pad, get this one. I was skeptical about their claims of recoil absorption, but they weren’t lying. This was definitely one of my best Amazon purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M.

customer_reviews.title: Seems good so far
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty good, haven’t had chance to shoot with it installed but feels a lot more absorbent than what was originally installed. I removed the standard recoil pad as instructed and it fit pretty well. There was some slight gapping on either side due to the shape of the stock, however after installing an elasticated shell holder onto the stock I was able to stretch it over the gaps and it provides a really good fit.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy!
customer_reviews.text: I have to get to the range, but it fits my marlin 1892 44mag lever-action very well. The rifle has a pretty good kick and this feels like it will help. I do really like that it gives me an extra inch to reach my shoulder, since I am 6'1, and it makes it easier to shoulder the rifle more comfortably with longer arms. I'd buy it again for another rifle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fellas preferred to shoot my Maverick 88 12 gauge over ...
customer_reviews.text: Fellas preferred to shoot my Maverick 88 12 gauge over my buddies older mossberg because of this. Shoot more skeet for a longer period of time!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Sizing Critical
customer_reviews.text: Based on the manufacture's sizing chart, I purchased a small for my Winchester Model 94 30-30 and a medium for my Winchester Model 1200 shotgun. The small fit the Model 94 perfectly. The medium was too loose on the Model 1200, so I tried the small. The small was a much better fit.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Recoil  Tamed!
customer_reviews.text: This works great to reduce the bad juju of recoil on my Tikka T3 precision rifle. I don't hunt but I enjoy precision rifle target shooting, and this makes my stay on the line a lot more comfortable, gives me more time and shots, and saves my shoulder. I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Indymaru

customer_reviews.title: Great shoulder pad for older and lighter stature people
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 60 year old father semi automatic 12 gauge. He recently purchased an ar based shotgun, and with his shoulder it still took a beating. With this pad installed it lightened the recoil significantly and made it more comfortable for him to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wrong item sent
customer_reviews.text: the item is fine however the seller sent the classic slip-on recoil pad in the box for the Airtech slip-on recoil pad. The difference is the classic one is up to 50% recoil reduction and the airtech is up to 70% reduction due to a new technology. That was somewhat misleading but too much hassle to initiate the return.
customer_reviews.author: fastest drummer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for non semi autos
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'3 200lbs and a very experienced shooter but if you put 3" slugs into a break action shotgun with a stock recoil pad, it's going to hurt. A lot. Turned my Charles Daly triple threat from unbearable to a pleasure to shoot. I'm not exaggerating.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Fits 1966 model 94
customer_reviews.text: This fits well on my 1966 Winchester model 94, seems tight and doesn't seem to slip around. I haven't fired the riffle with the Limbsaver yet but so far I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome recoil pad that will save your shoulder with magnum loads!
customer_reviews.text: Put this on a new KSG and ran 15 slugs through it. Normally, with my 870 I would be begging to stop at 15 slugs, but with the AirTech on the KSG and just a t-shirt I was good to go for more, no hickies or sore shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Jam Master Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Mosin!
customer_reviews.text: I messed up my shoulder a while back with my Mosin 91/30. I wasn't holding it tight and in combination with my blood thinner medication, it bruised it very badly. With everyone recommending the small size, I went ahead and purchased it. I took the gun out last week and swear the recoil was much lighter than my Savage .308. It slips on fairly easily and 1" Airtech design dampens the recoil substantially.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I'm doing something wrong...
customer_reviews.text: I gave 5 stars because the product itself is high quality and seems durable, there are plenty of other reviews stating it works great for people with 98Ks and Mosins, however this size (small) did not fit on any of my mil surp rifles, and the Mosin was the worst fit of them all because of how wide the metal butt plate is. I ordered the smallest one I could find and it still slips side to side, doesnt have a snug fit to the rifle.
customer_reviews.author: akar98

customer_reviews.title: Medium Air Tech
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Medium Air tech for a bolt action Rifle. It fits okay, looks okay. IT has a very STICKY feel to it. Inside is hollow. Not much to it for 30 bucks. Some difference but Very little in recoil from Factory Recoil pad. I would not buy another one
customer_reviews.author: LLP

customer_reviews.title: Med LimbSaver AirTech slip-on made my Stoeger 3500 was a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: The Med fit perfectly on my Stoeger 3500s. Felt better following the instructions of taking off the factory butt and replacing with the slip on LimbSaver, instead of just doubling on top. I tried it both ways and the LimbSaver by itself felt like a pillow. No bruising or shoulder fatigue after 100 rounds, while shooting clays.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend ordering one that is slightly smaller than what you ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an AR15 chambered in .458 SOCOM. Greatly reduced recoil but it fit the stock EXACTLY, which actually ended up being a problem because it didn't grab the stock tight enough to stay in place. Would recommend ordering one that is slightly smaller than what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Turned a heavy hitting .30-06's recoil to that of a .223.
customer_reviews.text: It fit the Boyds Pro Varmint laminated stock I installed on my Winchester Mod 70 Classic Sporter BOSS like a glove, and turned a sweet shooting rifle that wore out a shoulder after 40 rounds into an awesome rifle I can shoot all day and still drive a stick shift home from the range. I'm buying one for all my other rifles too.
customer_reviews.author: Giest

customer_reviews.title: Makes firing a 12g tolerable
customer_reviews.text: My Remington 870 beats up my shoulder after firing 00 buck loads for a while. I bought this thing and put it on, and it makes an enormous difference. Blew through a whole pile of shells without discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pad...
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with this pad. A friend of a friend has the same shotgun (mossberg 500) and went shooting clays. After 50 shots he was done and crying about his bruised shoulder the next day. I went clay shooting and shot close to 100 rounds through my gun. No bruise and the next day, I barely noticed i had done anything the previous day.
customer_reviews.author: volleygod

customer_reviews.title: Good recoil pad
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and SMALL size fits 870 Express pretty well. Definitely helps tame recoil compared to hard rubber factory pad. Only complaint would be the outer surface, as others have said it is a bit "tacky", I wouldn't say its sticky but it has a sticky feel. It doesn't slid against other surfaces, gun case, clothing, etc. And it appears to attract fuzz and fibers which stick to it to some degree. Not a major problem but I would definitely prefer if the outer surface was less tacky and smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M.

customer_reviews.title: STICKY
customer_reviews.text: The "Limbsaver" recoil pad fit my Mossberg SA 20 perfectly, however it's nearly impossible to shoulder the gun because the pad is so STICKY. It sticks to my jacket almost like velcro. Definitely the wrong kind of rubber for this application. I'll be returning for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Joyrider

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: i have had these on my older guns before but tried on they said would be a prefect fit to my mark 5 but it wasn't so i found this one and tried it and it fit over the butt nice and easy so i can shoot my 300 without killing my shoulder with the old hard butt that came on it
customer_reviews.author: michael pacetti

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my rifle, since it was a large bore cowboy lever action that had no butt pad. it fits pretty snub, though not overly. It has plenty of padding and my length of pull is still good. I thought I'd try this in lew of other methods of putting on a butt pad and I'm pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D.

customer_reviews.title: Fits my older 1100 12 gauge like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: I put this pad on an older Remington Model 1100 12 gauge. My arms are kind of long and I was fighting length of pull issues with the factory buttstock on my shotgun. I ordered the Medium pad for the extra inch of LOP and it fits the buttstock perfectly. This extra inch got my eye-line down closer to the bore line and helped me line up on the target better. If you're having length of pull issues, try a slip-on recoil pad.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Garland

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I had an older .243 rifle with a thin plastic butt pad before that did not take any of the recoil. For such a small caliber, you felt every bit of the recoil and could only shoot it about 10 times until my shoulder was done. I installed this pad and shot 20 plus rounds with no thought to the recoil. Slips on in seconds and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Recoil pad is outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Stoeger Double Defender really well and took the recoil down considerably. Went through about 20 rounds of 00 Buck 9 Pellet12 Gauge ammo (Wolf Performance ammo). Did not feel a thing and that was after my Savage 320 12 Gauge. Great product great price and make sure you measure your butt stock before buying a particular size. Apparently somethings do look closer than they are! Size varies from manufacturer to manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Mik Keith

customer_reviews.title: No more bruised shoulder
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these pussy pillows for 3 game rifles, a .308, a 7mm-08 and a 30-06. They really took the devil out of the recoil on that 30-06 pump with the plastic shoulder hammer. This is an awesome product. I am using all 3 in conjuction with stock guards to help hold them on, its working very well but I cannot say how they would hold on alone.
customer_reviews.author: PghDan79

customer_reviews.title: Must have for shotguns and large caliber rifles.
customer_reviews.text: Dampens recoil as well as all the other reviews say. This is a must have for shotguns and large caliber rifles. Keep in mind that this will add an inch to the length of pull of your gun. This is not an issue for most people but is important to keep in mind for very large guns or small shooters.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous junk.
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous junk. Even after returning for a smaller size recoil pad won't stay on the shotgun. It slips around and rolls under recoil allowing for dangerous movement. Movement that damn hear broke my nose yesterday. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: David Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for a Ruger American chambered in 30-06. Recoil ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a Ruger American chambered in 30-06. Recoil with heavy (220gr bullets) loads is really hard. The Limbsaver works as advertised to reduce the recoil substantially. Unfortunately, the recoil pad tends to slip which makes getting a consistent hold on the target hard. For sighting in and hunting will eliminate the Limbsaver. But, for building loads it really helps!
customer_reviews.author: Raider1950

customer_reviews.title: Fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, I ordered small/medium 0.5 lop for my Henry big boy 44mag lever action rifle, perfect size to slip over it and stay firm and on the rifle butt, won’t fall off, I kept stock pad on and put this over it to increase the length of pull, I’m very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Jason H.

customer_reviews.title: Best purchasr in a while.
customer_reviews.text: If you've ever fired as Springfield 1903a3 you know how bad the recoil can be after 25 or 30 rounds at the range. This LimbSaver is the ticket, as far as I'm concerned. My Smith-Corona 1903a3 will really hurt your shoulder after a while. This really saves the pain from even starting.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome recoil pad
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product , works well at reducing the recoil , easy on and easy off it actually moves around alittle too much for me so i'm returning it and gonna try another one, UPDATE - new one arrived yesterday and fits much tighter
customer_reviews.author: Bruce S.

customer_reviews.title: The material is not slippery like a gun butt so I couldn't slide the shotgun ...
customer_reviews.text: Bruise problems so have been very wary of shooting my shotgun. Bought this to use during a pheasant shoot. Used two boxes of shells without any problem at all. Really works! Just a note. If you slide your gun to your shoulder instead of going out and in you may have to change your technique. The material is not slippery like a gun butt so I couldn't slide the shotgun from my waist to my shoulder. In spite of that, definitely five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dave L

customer_reviews.title: This thing works!
customer_reviews.text: I put it on my 338-06 while I am shooting from the bench and it makes quite a difference. Yesterday I changed scopes at home and took the gun to the range to sight it in. With the first shot I remembered that I left the Limb Saver Slip-On at the house. I miss it more when I don’t have it. This thing tames the beast quite a bit. I cannot say what percentage difference it makes but it helps a lot. With the Limb Saver, my Bear Gun becomes a pleasure to shoot even from the bench.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wynne

customer_reviews.title: Winchester 94
customer_reviews.text: The small was a perfect fit for my Winchester 30/30 model 94. Getting older here need to reduce kick some. Will be getting one for both of my shotguns now
customer_reviews.author: Garry W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Mosin Nagant
customer_reviews.text: The Mosin has a metal plate on the butt, and after a few rounds you can feel it on the shoulder. But after using this, I can go out and shoot all day with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Witt

customer_reviews.title: Small size fits an Enfield No 4 MK II tightly but securely.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. I needed the extra 1 inch length of pull on my Enfield No 4 MK II with short rear stock. Small/medium works fine but is on the loose side so can slip off inadvertently at times. Small is tight, but stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Arant

customer_reviews.title: The small size fit perfect on my Wife's Franchi Affinity Compact 20gauge
customer_reviews.text: The small size fit perfect on my Wife's Franchi Affinity Compact 20gauge. haven't actually fired it yet with this pad, but wanted to "build the database" on what sizes fit what guns.
customer_reviews.author: Brew

customer_reviews.title: Makes an M1 Garand easy to shoot
customer_reviews.text: This buttstock pad is amazing. I bought this for my Civilian Marksmanship Program M1 Garand. Before I got this shooting that rifle left my shoulder very sore. With the limited saver on the rifle I have no shoulder soreness the next day. Plus the recoil is so much better. I really love this thing. My only complaint is due to the rubber nature of the pad it tends to get stuck on jackets and can make repositioning the rifle a little difficult, but it's not a major issue.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R. Long

customer_reviews.title: Exact fit Size Medium
customer_reviews.text: Limbsaver is exactly what it says! Fantastic product. For all Stevens 320 12g with synthetic stock get Size Medium 1” Thick (Lop)- 10551 it fits like a glove. Feels perfect, no need to modify or customize. Exact fit!
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro G. Ribe

customer_reviews.title: They do just as they say!
customer_reviews.text: While I bought them to increase the length of pull, they definitely absorb the sharpest bit of recoil, leaving the 'push'. I have found that it makes me less likely to jerk the trigger in anticipation, and that I can turn a 15 shot target shooting trip into 50 or 60 without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: FoolForChrist

customer_reviews.title: ... shoulder pain and bruises all gone shooting with it fun i actually can not believe that huge difference it ...
customer_reviews.text: Real deal - i got it for my pump action shotgun and it does miracle - no more shoulder pain and bruises all gone shooting with it fun i actually can not believe that huge difference it makes to shoot with this little thing! Highly recommend it to anyone! and NO i am not friend of seller or thing like that :)
customer_reviews.author: marcel de jardin

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: About 20 rounds sighting in a new AR in 450 BM I was really hurting. I borrowed a slip on Limbsaver from a friend and was able to complete my task, about 40 rounds total. I have since ordered a couple for various other rifles.
customer_reviews.author: Exit 42

customer_reviews.title: Takes away recoil as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 12ga field O/U gun that has a wood butt plate. The gun is fine with 2 3/4” shells but kicks very hard with 3” magnums but this pads allows me to comfortably shoot it all day without any discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend the LimbSaver Airtech Slip-On Recoil Pad. I have a 12 year old son who's a little on the small side I purchased him a Remington 770 .243 the first time he shot the rifle it was uncomfortable to him enough that it cause him to jerk the trigger the next time we went out. I bought him the limbSaver Airtech and now he's shooting like a pro, so much so I bought another one for his aging father....to put on my M77 30-06.. but make sure to measure your stock for the current size...
customer_reviews.author: sherri Lokken

customer_reviews.title: Great fit on Ruger m77 Hawkeye
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a “Medium “ 1” lop Once removed original butt pad, slipped on perfect. Excellent fit for Ruger m77 Hawkeye African 416 ruger. No slippage, no gap... no movement. Snug , nice fit!
customer_reviews.author: Rick R

customer_reviews.title: They names it correctly
customer_reviews.text: Slipped this onto my Marlin 336 in .35 Remington and now I can stand to shoot it again. That thing kicks like a mule but this tames that recoil well enough to make sighting in a scope doable.
customer_reviews.author: James W Lee

customer_reviews.title: Mossberg 500
customer_reviews.text: I followed the measurement guidelines and other reviewers stating it may slip or move around, so I ordered the small size for my 4 3/4" long stock on my Mossberg 500 pump shotgun. Fits snug and should be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: exitkc

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly and appears to be of good quality. I look forward to reduced recoil from the shotgun I installed it on. LOP only changed slightly (approximately 1/2”) by addition of this pad.
customer_reviews.author: JRO

customer_reviews.title: Mossberg Maverick 88 18.5 Slip-On Recoil Pad
customer_reviews.text: Mossberg Shotgun Maverick 88 Security 12 GA 18.5 Barrel. Removed original butt pad. Two Phillip head screws. Slipped on recoil pad, MEDIUM size. Item Number 10551. Fit perfect! Remember I did remove original butt pad as per AirTech. Have not shot it yet, but it feels great to the shoulder. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Cook

customer_reviews.title: Dude buy it
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly, super absorbent, if it was yellow I'd call it Spongebob. This things great. Medium fit both my mid and high calibers with different stock styles. Even fits an archangel with a bit of work removing the rubber puck they call a recoil reducer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very nice item
customer_reviews.text: took my shotgun from a punishment device for smaller people and turned it into something i have to remind them they cant take it with them when they leave. love it works great
customer_reviews.author: thomas gilroy

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect on an old Remington 742 30-06
customer_reviews.text: The old model 742 30-06 we have was made in the 1950's. Heavy wood stock, solid old gun but it kicked pretty hard. This pad made it noticeably easier on the shoulder. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Hall

customer_reviews.title: It made a helpful difference
customer_reviews.text: in shooting comfort for my 50# grandson - and his 100 pound mom. Some folks complained about its retention; I used one of the original butt screws to assist in holding it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: mosin 91/30 perfect fit with small, works so well
customer_reviews.text: Using on my mosin 91/30. Its crazy how good it actually works, brought that kick giving me and my fiance a good bruise down to literally nothing whatsoever. Its comfortable enough, slips right on, im really happy with it. I thought it was a little pricey at the time 35 dollars, im not sure how cheaper options would perform, but im glad i got this one.
customer_reviews.author: Iverson S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice pad. If in doubt, so smaller.
customer_reviews.text: I lost the first pad I ordered when it slipped off. My gun was right between a medium and small. Bought a small, and it seems like it will stay on better. Just wish there was a size small with the .5 LOP.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect ...I’m 63 and have a bad shoulder this pad took the majority of the recoil away on my old single shot 20 gauge making it a joy to shoot again thanks
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: works perfect on Benelli Ethos - with youth stock
customer_reviews.text: I have a lovely new gun but everytime i went clay shooting it looked like I got my shoulder beat to hell. This has saved my shoulder immensely. No bruising and it saves my shoulder so I can do a whole day of shooting with no problem. Really great product!
customer_reviews.author: RebeccaS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: This pad was very easy to install and fit perfectly. It is very comfortable and stays put. I'll definitely be purchasing another one in the near future. AAA+++
customer_reviews.author: Scott P.

customer_reviews.title: Slip on, slip off!
customer_reviews.text: Good at what its supposed to do, however mine keeps slipping off, the small is too small and large is too large so I got the medium, strongly considering some epoxy and trimming off the slip over part
customer_reviews.author: Kozel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Put these on my Marlin 336 in 30-30. easy to install just slipped right in with no issues. It looks great in my opinion and i dont feel hardly any recoil anymore. great product
customer_reviews.author: SoundWave702

customer_reviews.title: Great Help
customer_reviews.text: this helped to take the little bite that the 30-30 had and made it more enjoyable to shoot for long periods of time. i wouldn't expect anything less from these and the fit was nice and sung.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: This took my ability to shoot 4 or 5 shells before my arm felt like it was going to fall off to now shooting ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit onto my shotgun perfectly and provides a much needed cushion. This took my ability to shoot 4 or 5 shells before my arm felt like it was going to fall off to now shooting upwards of 20 while still feeling good. I put this on a 12 Gauge slug gun used primarily for deer hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: Works for Panzer AR12 4th Generation
customer_reviews.text: Used not the largest size for my Ar12 and that gave a good fit. However, price is really expensive considering that you buy basically a piece of rubber.
customer_reviews.author: Las Vegas Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Say Goodbye to 12 Gauge Recoil!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product! I put it on my Kel Tec KSG and the difference in felt recoil is incredible! This past week, I put over 500 12 gauge rounds through my KSG while having fun with my family and I felt like I could go for 500 more! For reference, my brother was ready to call it quits after 200 rounds through his Mossberg because he doesn't have a Limbsaver. Needless to say, I'm buying more to go on all of my larger caliber firearms, and I'm sending my brother a couple as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what is claimed.
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a KelTec KS7. Being a bullpup 12ga the hit was HARD. This took away so much of the recoil. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Hill

product_meta.title: LimbSaver Airtech Slip-On Recoil Pad
product_meta.description:
Reducing felt recoil by up to 70 percent, the advanced LimbSaver AirTech Recoil Pad is available as a slip-on option for most rifles, shotguns and muzzleloaders. It features advanced atmospheric chambers that produce a substantial increase in performance through uniform energy dissipation, and it incorporates anti-muzzle jump technology for faster target re-acquisition. The recoil pad helps increase accuracy of follow-up shots and you'll enjoy increased control for maximum stability.

Designed to easily slip over existing firearm stocks without any modifications, the AirTech Recoil Pad will work best with removing the current factory recoil pad before installation. The AirTech Slip-On can be installed directly over the factory recoil pad to increase the length-of-pull by 1 inch (LOP), but to achieve optimum performance, LimbSaver recommends the removal of the existing factory recoil pad. It's made from LimbSaver's proprietary NAVCOM technology (Noise and Vibration Control Material), which effectively absorbs a wide range of frequencies to dissipate energy and vibration. This recoil pad also features a no-slip surface that stays in place even in the rain.

It comes in four sizes:

 * Small fits stocks measuring 4-1/2 x 1-1/2 inches to 4-13/16 x 1-5/8 inches
 * Small/Medium fits stocks measuring 4-5/8 x 1-9/16 inches to 5-1/8 x 1-3/4 inches
 * Medium fits stocks measuring 4-13/16 x 1-5/8 inches to 5-1/8″ x 1-3/4 inches
 * Large fits stocks measuring 5-1/8 x 1-3/4 inches to 5-3/8 x 1-7/8 inches

Using state-of-the-art technologies, LimbSaver produces highly effective noise- and vibration-dampening products for archery and firearm products, including bow stabilizers, recoil pads, rifle slings, and more. Proudly engineered and hand-made in the USA, LimbSaver products are widely used by outdoor enthusiasts, military, law enforcement, and more.
feature_bullets: Slip-on recoil pad for most rifles, shotguns and muzzleloaders; reduces up to 70 percent of felt recoil
Easily installs over existing firearm stocks without any modifications
Incorporates anti-muzzle jump technology for faster target re-acquisition
Made from LimbSaver's proprietary vibration-dampening NAVCOM material
Non-slip surface ideal for use in all harsh weather conditions
